attributes.action: Stop letting UK parliament and House of commons blocking or extending Article 50
attributes.additional_details:
The 2016 UK, European Union membership referendum took place in the UK on the 23 June 2016. Membership of the European Union has been a topic of debate in the United Kingdom since the country joined the European Communities (or "the Common Market", as it was usually then known) in 1973

Vote Results
Votes	%
Leave	17,410,742	51.89%
Remain	16,141,241	48.11%
Valid votes	33,551,983	99.92%
Invalid or blank votes	25,359	0.08%
Total votes	33,577,342	100.00%
Registered voters/turnout	46,500,001	72.21%
attributes.background: 17.4 million UK citizens voted out of the European Union. UK parliamentand and the House of commons are voted and appointed by UK citizens serve the will of the people. This is democracy and parliament must act now. Or this is misconduct
